pageContext.description: Broken across butt & slightly cracked below stops. Considerably worn.
pageContext.patina: powdery blue green, encrused with yellowish green to brown, patina (shown shaded) core. light purple brown with gleaming slivery gold & purple grains.
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum 1923, F. Drinkwater Esq. M.R.C.V.S., 26 Victoria Drive, West Kirby, from the collection of his uncle, the late Rev. C.H. Drinkwater, vicar of St George's, Shrewsbury. 1872 to 1923.
pageContext.site: Shropshire, Shrewsbury, Meole Brace, England, Shropshire, Hanwood (near), Meole Brace, Hanwood Road (SE side of road, about 1/2 way between Hanwood & Shrewsbury). In a brickfield in a pocket of grey gravel in boulder clay 15 feet deep., about 1897 or 8
pageContext.toSearch: Meole Brace, Shrewsbury, Shrewsbury, Shropshire Sy3, United Kingdom
